data.value: Financial assets and financial liabilities are recognised when the entity becomes a party to the contractual provisions to the instrument.

Financial assets are classified into the following categories: amortised cost, fair value through profit or loss (FVPL), equity instruments at fair value through other comprehensive income (FVOCI), and debt instruments at FVOCI.
Loans and receivables are measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method.
The fair value of financial assets and liabilities must be estimated for recognition and measurement or for disclosure purposes.
The Group recognises a loss allowance for expected credit losses on receivables.

elements.title: Operating and Financial Review - Risk Factors

data.value: The Group's exploration activities are being delayed due to lack of available equipment and services.
High demand for drilling equipment and exploration-related services in Western Australia is resulting in higher costs and delays.
Further capital will be needed for exploration and development of properties, and failure to obtain financing may delay activities.
The Group may be adversely affected by fluctuations in commodity prices which are unpredictable.
Adverse global financial conditions may negatively impact growth and profitability of the Group.

data.value: An operating segment is a component of an entity that engages in business activities from which it may earn revenues and incur expenses including revenues and expenses relating to transactions with other components of the same entity. Management will consider other factors in determining operating segments.
The income tax expense for the year is the tax payable on the current year's taxable income adjusted by changes in deferred tax assets and liabilities attributable to temporary differences.
Provision is made for the amount of any dividend declared on or before the end of the year but not distributed at balance date.
